abstract: The way we eat and the way we feed our children has more of an influence than we realize.
snippet: The way we eat and the way we feed our children has more of an influence than we realize.
lead_paragraph: Last spring, Allison Robicelli wrote an essay titled "Chicken Nuggets and French Fries: Confessions of a Mother and a Chef," on Nona Brooklyn, and Lisa Belkin linked to it here on Motherlode. I read it; many of you did. We sympathized with the chef whose kid loved French fries best, and we had ideas.

headline.main: Changing What Your Children Choose to Eat
